act_info.full_title: Spruce Pulpwood Exportation Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. S.17
act_info.citation: Spruce Pulpwood Exportation Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. S.17

content.section: Prohibition of exportation in special Acts may be suspended
content.content: 1. Where lands have been granted pursuant to any special Act as a subsidy to any railway or other company in connection with the establishment of its undertaking in Ontario and by such Act the exportation from Canada of spruce pulpwood cut from such lands in an unmanufactured condition is prohibited, the Lieutenant Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Natural Resources and despite anything in any such Act or in any patent from the Crown of lands granted pursuant thereto, may suspend the operation of any such prohibition and may permit the exportation of spruce pulpwood cut from such lands in an unmanufactured condition for such period and upon such terms and conditions as the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers proper. R.S.O. 1980, c.479, s.1. ____________________ Français
content.raw_html:
1. Where lands have been granted pursuant to any special Act as a subsidy to any railway or other company in connection with the establishment of its undertaking in Ontario and by such Act the exportation from Canada of spruce pulpwood cut from such lands in an unmanufactured condition is prohibited, the Lieutenant Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Natural Resources and despite anything in any such Act or in any patent from the Crown of lands granted pursuant thereto, may suspend the operation of any such prohibition and may permit the exportation of spruce pulpwood cut from such lands in an unmanufactured condition for such period and upon such terms and conditions as the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers proper. R.S.O. 1980, c.479, s.1.

____________________

Français
